sen.j: 寒風古窯跡群（さぶかぜこようせきぐん）は岡山県瀬戸内市牛窓町長浜にある須恵器窯の遺跡。
sen.e: Sabukaze Koyoseki-gun (寒風古窯跡群) is a group of remains of kilns of Sueki (須恵器, unglazed ware) in Nagahama, Ushimado-cho, Setouchi City, Okayama Prefecture.
Sabukaze Koyoseki-gun is a group of remains of kilns of Sueki (unglazed ware) in Nagahama, Ushimado-cho, Setouchi City, Okayama Prefecture.

sen.j: 国の史跡。

sen.j: 瀬戸内市内には古墳時代から平安時代にかけての須恵器窯跡が点在し、「邑久古窯跡群」と呼ばれており、中四国地方最大の須恵器生産地であった。
sen.e: The city of Setouchi is dotted with the kiln sites of Sueki from the Kofun period to the Heian period, and they are called "Oku koyoseki-gun" (邑久古窯跡群, Oku old kiln site group), which was the largest place of production of Sueki in the Chugoku and Shikoku region.

sen.j: 操業期間は7世紀の飛鳥時代を中心とした約100年間である。
sen.e: Unglazed ware was produced there for about 100 years mainly in the Asuka period of the seventh century.

sen.j: 昭和初頭、地元の郷土史研究家である時実黙水（ときざね もくすい）は遺跡周辺の須恵器を大量に採取、研究誌を発表しここに遺跡があることが認知されるようになった。
sen.e: In the early Showa period, a local history researcher and local resident, Mokusui TOKIZANE collected a large quantity of Sueki around the remains and published the research paper on them, with the result that it has gotten recognized that the remains are here.

sen.j: 遺跡は1号窯・2号窯・3号窯から成る。
sen.e: The remains contain the first kiln, the second kiln and the third kiln.

sen.j: 1号窯には3基の窯跡が確認されており、現在は3号窯まで合計5基の窯跡が確認されている。
sen.e: Three kiln sites have been recognized in the first kiln, and so at present five kiln sites in total have been recognized through to the third kiln.

sen.j: 窯で焼かれていた須恵器は、主に蓋・杯（つき）・高杯・平瓶（ひらか）・皿・甕・鉢などであった。
sen.e: Sueki which were fired in these kilns were mainly gai (a lid), tsuki (a drinking cup), takatsuki (a standing tray for cake and fruit), hiraka (a flattened bottle), sara (a dish), kame (an earthware pot), hatch (a bowl), and so on.

sen.e: What is more, to name special things, tokan (ceramic coffin), shibi (ornamental ridge-end tile) with which the roof of a temple was decorated, and earthenware like a suzuri (ink stone) which was used in government offices were made, too.
